channel.title: WSJ Minute Briefing
channel.copyright: Copyright © Dow Jones & Company, Inc. All rights reserved.
channel.description: The top business headlines from The Wall Street Journal, three times daily. Whether it’s the latest on overseas markets, economic news out of Washington or closing numbers from Wall Street, you'll be in the know in a flash.
channel.itunes:author: The Wall Street Journal
channel.itunes:summary: The top business headlines from The Wall Street Journal, three times daily. Whether it’s the latest on overseas markets, economic news out of Washington or closing numbers from Wall Street, you'll be in the know in a flash.
channel.content:encoded: The top business headlines from The Wall Street Journal, three times daily. Whether it’s the latest on overseas markets, economic news out of Washington or closing numbers from Wall Street, you'll be in the know in a flash.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Finish Higher on Jobs Report
item.description:
Plus: Starbucks shares up more than 8% a day after reporting record sales. DraftKings shares fall 28% after the company said higher revenue was offset by a decline in fantasy-sports players. J.R. Whalen reports.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.content:encoded:

item.title: U.S. Employers Added 261,000 Jobs in October
item.description:
The jobs report sparks a rally in U.S. stocks. Plus: Russian attacks on Ukraine’s capital leave half a million homes without electricity. J.R. Whalen reports.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: U.S., Allies Specify Russian Oil Sales Subject to Price Cap
item.description:
Musk’s Twitter tells staff layoffs will be announced Friday. Chinese shares surge as covid reopening hopes emerge, U.S. audit inspections end. Mohsin Ali hosts.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Fall for Second Day
item.description:
Plus: Lyft shares fall 2% after the company said it plans to cut about 700 jobs. Starbucks shares rise more than 2% after hours, after reporting record quarterly sales, but higher costs that cut into profits. J.R. Whalen reports.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Mortgage Rates Dip Back Below 7%
item.description:
Plus: Former Pakistani Prime Minister shot and injured at a protest rally. Peloton reports quarterly sales fell 23% and expects sales to fall in the holiday quarter. J.R. Whalen reports.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: North Korea Test-Fires ICBM, Triggering Warnings in Japan
item.description:
Canada orders three Chinese companies to divest their shares from domestic companies involved in extracting critical minerals. Activist investor Carl Icahn has a significant stake in beverage-can maker Crown Holdings. Keith Collins hosts.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: U.S. Stocks Sell Off After Fed Raises Interest Rates 0.75%
item.description:
Fed chairman Jerome Powell says the central bank is not ready to pause rate increases. Plus: interest-rate hike pushes tech stocks lower. After the bell, chip maker Qualcomm issues negative sales outlook and cuts its forecast for smartphone shipments. J.R. Whalen reports.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Russia Resumes Participation in Ukraine Grain Transports
item.description:
Plus: CVS, Walgreens propose more than $10 billion in settlements to resolve opioid-crisis lawsuits. Several top U.S. business schools to offer online MBA programs for the first time next year. J.R. Whalen reports.

item.title: North Korea Unleashes Barrage of Test-Fired Missiles
item.description:
In Israel, former Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is on the brink of a political comeback. Twitter’s new owner, Elon Musk, says blocked users won’t be allowed back until a process is in place. Keith Collins hosts.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Decline Ahead of Fed Interest-Rate Announcement
item.description:
Plus: Shares of Abiomed rise 50% after Johnson & Johnson announces plan to buy the company. Airbnb shares fall 4% after hours after reporting higher revenue but lower-than-expected number of nights booked by travelers. J.R. Whalen reports.

item.title: Supreme Court Blocks House From Seeing Trump’s Tax Returns
item.description:
Plus: Uber says quarterly revenue rose 72% compared to a year ago. U.S. job openings rose in September as demand for workers outpaces the number of unemployed people looking for work. J.R. Whalen reports.

item.title: U.S. Plans to Send B-52 Bombers to Australia in Effort to Counter China
item.description:
Penguin Random House blocked from acquiring rival publisher Simon & Schuster. And Saudi Aramco profit jumps 39% on high oil prices. Mohsin Ali hosts.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Finish Lower, Show Gains for October
item.description:
Plus: Oil prices notched their first monthly gain since May. Meta shares down 6.1%. Apple shares lose 1.5-percent after a major contributor to iPhone production struggles with a Covid-19 outbreak in China. J.R. Whalen reports.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Supreme Court to Hear College-Admission Race Cases
item.description:
Plus: China’s factory output contracts in October due to Covid lockdowns, fading demand for Chinese-made goods. New car prices in the U.S. start to decline after multi-year gains. J.R. Whalen reports.

item.title: Russia Launches Barrage of Missile Strikes Across Ukraine
item.description:
Brazil’s leftist former president Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva beat conservative incumbent Jair Bolsonaro. Emerson Electric is selling a majority stake in its climate-tech business to Blackstone. Keith Collins hosts.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Rise Sharply; Apple Leads Dow Gains
item.description:
Plus: Meta shares rise 1.3%. Exxon Mobil gains 2 9% after reporting record quarterly profits. Amazon falls 6.8%, dragging down consumer discretionary stocks. J.R. Whalen reports.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: U.S. Worker Pay, Benefits Rose in Third Quarter
item.description:
Employment-cost index climbed 5% as employers competed for workers in tight labor market. Consumer spending rose 0.6% last quarter. European Union warns Elon Musk that Twitter will have to follow bloc’s new content-moderation rules. J.R. Whalen reports.

item.title: Elon Musk Completes Twitter Takeover, Fires CEO and CFO
item.description:
In Ukraine, Kyiv residents face prolonged blackouts after Russia again strikes the nation’s power grid. The U.S. Justice Department is investigating how poultry companies pay chicken farmers. Keith Collins hosts.

item.title: Tech Stocks Decline; Apple, Amazon Report Earnings
item.description:
Shares of Meta Platforms fall nearly 25%. Apple reports record quarterly revenue, but says iPhone 14 Pro supplies are constrained. Amazon returns to profitability but warns on holiday sales. J.R. Whalen reports.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
